III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Program statement
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents’ needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 2/5/24, a youth entered the room of another youth and
physically assaulted the youth. The youth were unsupervised for
an undetermined amount of time.
Investigation Interviews:
Therapist/Complaint source was interviewed face to face at the
facility on February 6, 2024. Therapist reported he received these
allegations second hand from Supervisor. He reported he spoke with
Youth A and Youth B due to the concerns of being found in the room
alone with one another. Therapist reported Youth A stated he
punched Youth B because he was made at Youth B for stating he
wanted to date Youth A’s sister. Youth B denied Youth A ever
punched him.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at school on February 9,
2024, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth A reported
everyone in the unit has their own rooms and in order to get into your
room staff have to open the door. He reported staff perform room
checks about every fifteen minutes or less sometimes. Youth A
reported youth are not allowed to go into other youth rooms. He
reported he went into Youth B’s room the other day. Youth A got mad
at Youth B for talking about his sister, so he got Youth B to allow him
into his room. He reported he then started to hit him. Youth A
reported he knew it was not right to do but he was upset. Youth A
reported staff came immediately and removed him. He reported he
went into Youth B’s room between checks when he knew staff would
not be coming and tried to hide in the closet when staff did come in,
but they found him. Youth A reported he got moved to a different
hallway because of this incident.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at school on February 9,
2024, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth B reported
things are boring on the unit and is upset Youth D gets to go to a
community placement when he has hit him before. Youth B was
asked if there was any other concerns on the unit and he reported
2

Youth A had sexual assaulted him. When asked what that looked
like, Youth B reported Youth A had pinched and slapped his butt
when he came into his room the other night. Youth B reported Youth
A came into his room after a room check and told him not to say
anything to anyone or he would hurt him. Youth B reported he did his
defense mechanism and went down to the ground in the fetal
position. Staff 1 came to the bedroom and assisted Youth B with
getting out the room. He reported Staff 3 got Youth A out of his room
and moved to a different hallway. Youth B reported Youth A has
touched him on the bus as well before but has not told anyone about
that until this incident with the room occurred. Youth B reported staff
do complete room checks at night.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on February
9, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth C reported
things are going well at the facility. He reported everyone at the
facility has their own bedroom and youth are not supposed to go into
other rooms. Youth C reported the other night he was coming out of
the shower and heading back to his room, Youth D told him Youth A
was in Youth B’s room. He reported he went and told Staff 1 right
away who then came immediately to address the situation. Youth C
reported he did not see what happened but did see Staff 1 get Youth
B out of the room first. He reported staff complete bed checks all the
time at random times to make sure the youth are safe. Youth C
reported he had no concerns with staff supervision.
Youth D was interviewed face to face at school on February 9,
2024, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth D reported
everyone at the facility has their own bedrooms. He reported staff
perform random check-ins on youth in their rooms. Youth D reported
his room is next to Youth A’s room. He stated the other night, Youth
B was talking about Youth A’s sister when they were both in their
own rooms. Youth A got out of his room and knocked on Youth B’s
door who allowed Youth A in. Youth D reported Youth A then
slammed Youth B against the door. The door then closed, and Youth
D heard something drop and heard Youth B say I am scared. Youth
C was coming out of the shower at that time and Youth D told Youth
C that Youth A was in Youth B’s room. Youth C told Staff 1 who
came rushing down to deal with the situation. Youth A was moved to
another hallway. Youth D reported Youth A went into Youth B’s room
after a room check had already been completed.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on February 9,
2024, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1 reported she
was working on February 5, 2024, when the incident occurred. She
reported she had just completed a room check, where Youth A,
Youth B, and Youth D were in their rooms and Youth C was in the
shower. She stated she was in the milieu completing paperwork
3

when Youth C came out and told her Youth A was in Youth B’s room.
Staff 1 reported she went to the room immediately and opened the
door. When she looked in the room, Youth B was lying on the floor in
the fetal position, and she got Youth B out of the room and went to
Staff 2. Youth A was still hiding within the room, and she was able to
get him out of the room. Both of the youth were talked to, and nothing
was disclosed that anything happened. Staff 1 reported Youth A was
moved to the other hallway. She stated that there had been no
concern between Youth A and Youth B, so it was surprising that this
occurred.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on February
13, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 2 reported he
worked on February 5, 2024, with Staff 1 and Staff 3. He reported
Youth B, Youth C, and Youth D had all gone to a basketball game
and Youth A stayed back at the facility. The three youths returned
from the basketball game past their 8pm bedtime and Youth A was
already in bed. Staff 2 reported Youth A was already in a pre-
escalated state due to his clean-up job in the sensory room with Staff
3. He reported Staff 1 and Staff 3 assisted with getting the four
youths into the rooms and ready for the bed. Once the youth were all
in their room, Staff 2 worked on some paperwork in the staff office.
Staff 3 went to clean the rest of the sensory room, and Staff 1 went to
the staff desk to complete room checks. Staff 2 reported moments
after Staff 1 had completed their room checks, Youth C came back
out of the hallway and reported Youth A was in Youth B’s room. He
reported he was not present when that occurred but when he saw
Staff 1 going down to the room, he came out of the staff office. Staff
2 reported Youth B came out of his room and Staff 2 took him into
the staff office as he did not know what was exactly going out. Staff 2
reported he asked Youth B what happened and at first, he refused to
talk about it. After Staff 2 reassured Youth B he was safe, Youth B
disclosed, that Youth A had knocked on his door and he opened the
door. Youth A pushed Youth B into his door and went into Youth B’s
room. Youth B reported he went into the fetal position on the ground
and Youth A had slapped and pinched his butt. Staff 2 reported
Youth A was moved into another hallway and all appropriate people
were reported to about this incident. Staff 2 reported everyone on
shift was doing what they needed to do, and this occurred right after
a room check was completed. He reported there were no previous
concerns with Youth A and Youth B as they had been playing the
video games and Magic the card game. Staff 2 reported he has no
concerns with the staff doing the room checks timely.
Staff 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on February
13, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 3 reported on
February 5, 2024, she was working with Youth A in the sensory room
while Youth B, Youth C, and Youth D were at a basketball game. She
4

reported Youth A was helping clean up the room, got frustrated with
the vacuum, and was upset when redirected. Staff 3 reported Youth
A went down to his room at bedtime and the three other youth
returned home a little after bedtime. She reported everyone went to
their room and she was working with Staff 1 to make sure everyone
was getting settled. Staff 3 reported she assisted with opening Youth
C’s bedroom door when he was done with the shower. She reported
when she was walking down the hallway she noticed, that Youth A
had propped his door open with a shoe. Staff 3 reported she went to
check in on Youth A and reminded him that this is not allowed and
removed the shoe. She reported she then spoke with Staff 1 briefly
and returned to the sensory room to finish cleaning up. Staff 3
reported when she walked back into the unit, Staff 2 had Youth B in
the staff office and Youth A was sitting in the milieu. She reported
she was not present when everything occurred. Staff 3 reported she
believes the situation was handled appropriately and everyone was
doing the room checks as it was supposed to be done, with variable
intervals not to exceed fifteen minutes.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on
February 9, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker.
Supervisor reported she was not present when the situation occurred
but did receive a call from Staff 2 about it. She reported that she was
told Youth A got into Youth B’s room and the plan is to keep the
youth separated until further notice. Supervisor reported she spoke
with both of the boys after the incident. She stated from those
interviews, Youth B wanted to play magic cards with Youth A and
that is how Youth A got into the room. Youth A reported he lied to
Youth B about the game just so he got in there to beat him up from
Youth B talking about Youth A’s sister. Youth B denied getting hurt
but stated Youth A slapped and pinched Youth B’s butt. Youth C was
the one to tell the staff about the situation. This event occurred not
even five minutes after the last room check.
Tour Observation:
A tour of the facility occurred on February 9, 2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Walking onto the unit there is a
milieu area. Near the back area of the milieu there is a staff desk
where staff can see the milieu area. To the left and right of the staff
desk there are locked doors that lead down to the hallway of the
youth’s bedrooms. Within the left hallway, is where Youth A, Youth B,
Youth C, and Youth D’s bedrooms are located. Youth A and Youth B
had rooms across the hall from one another. The youth are able to
open their doors to get out of their rooms, but staff need to unlock the
doors to allow them in.
Documents Reviewed:
5

- Facility incident report dated 02/05/24 completed by
Staff 1- This incident report notes that on 02/05/24 around
8:50pm, Youth C ran into the milieu and told Staff 1 Youth
A was in Youth B’s room. Staff 1 went down to the hallway,
opened the door, and found Youth B on his back in the fetal
position. Staff 1 got Youth B to come out of his room and
walked him down to Staff 2. Staff 1 then got Youth A out of
the bedroom and moved his living space to the other
hallway away from Youth B.
- Facility Residential Bed Checks dated 02/05/24 to
02/06/24- Bed checks were completed appropriately for all
the youth. Room checks were completed in variable
intervals no more than fifteen minutes between times. At
8:37pm and 8:47pm, Staff 1 had completed a room check
of all the youth which were all in their appropriate spots. At
8:50pm was when Youth C notified Staff 1 of Youth A going
into Youth B’s room which was immediately addressed.
- Facility Staff Ratio Policy with recent revision date of
07/06/18- This policy notes, “Direct care staff members are
required to maintain line-of-sight supervision of youths at all
times except when youth are in their individual sleep rooms
or bathrooms.”
- Bed Checks Policy with recent revision date of
05/30/18- This policy notes, “Bed checks much be
conducted at variable intervals, with no more than fifteen
minutes between checks.”
- Staff 1, Staff 2, Staff 3’s Human Resource files were all
reviewed- Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff 3 all had no
disciplinary actions noted within their files and they were all
up to date on their trainings.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance with following their supervision
and bed check policy. It was found Staff 1 had completed a bed
check right before Youth A went into Youth B’s room after the bed
check. Staff 1 responded to the situation when told by Youth C
and followed all proper protocol.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
6

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
